metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8137 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Double free vulnerability in the jas_iccattrval_destroy function in JasPer1.900.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted ICC color profilein a JPEG 2000 image file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8137` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjasper-runtime - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.2
libjasper1 - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jasper package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.900.1-14ubuntu3.2').
